entry.title: ““People in our neighborhood, they say they feel for the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

““People in our neighborhood, they say they feel for the homeless. And yet they call them criminals and don’t want them to be in their neighborhood,” said Alexis Valeriano Hernandez, who helped organize the protest on Tuesday morning with his partner My Khe Nguyen. “They say ‘Put them in another yard that is not mine’ without really addressing a solution.”

Colorado Newsline

Denver residents Sophie Elias and her husband have lived in a tent at the corner of 14th Avenue and Logan Street for the past month and a half. They got married last month and moved to the area after the homeless encampment in front of Morey Middle School was dispersed in early August. On Tuesday [....

entry.title: "Higher income earners have not only been more likely to...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Higher income earners have not only been more likely to have jobs they could do from the safety of their homes during pandemic shutdowns, but they also are more like to have the computers and broadband service to do them. Indeed, COVID-19 has exacerbated the digital divide — along with many other divides separating the haves from have-nots, many from minority and immigrant communities who get by on low wages."

Denverite

Denver-based Mercy Housing, one of the nation’s largest nonprofit developers and managers of income-restricted housing, is piloting free internet in Sun Valley.

denverite.com

COVID-19 has exacerbated a digital divide that affordable housing providers in Denver are trying to close

Denver-based Mercy Housing, one of the nation’s largest nonprofit developers and managers of income-restricted housing, is piloting free internet in Sun Valley.Denver-based Mercy Housing, one of the nation’s largest nonprofit developers and managers of income-restricted housing, is piloting free internet in Sun Valley.

entry.title: The Colorado Civil Rights Division (CCRD) enforces...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

The Colorado Civil Rights Division (CCRD) enforces anti-discrimination laws in housing, employment, and places of public accommodation, including under Colorado's new CROWN Act. To file a discrimination complaint, visit ccrd.colorado.gov.

Colorado Department of Regulatory Agencies

The Colorado Civil Rights Division (CCRD) enforces anti-discrimination laws in housing, employment, and places of public accommodation, including under Colorado's new CROWN Act. To file a discrimination complaint, visit ccrd.colorado.gov.

entry.title: "The first part of the movie features former extremists...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The first part of the movie features former extremists telling their story. And then in the middle, you focus on people who would have been folks these extremists would have victimized. Why did you want to set it up that way?
What I felt was missing was a section about how horrible it feels to be the victim of prejudice. I didn’t want to forget about the victims. So I interviewed some people from marginalized groups, including three from Colorado: State Representative Leslie Herod, [Colorado Muslim Leadership Council member] Nadeen Ibrahim, and Nicole Garcia, [the first transgender person and person of color to serve as a minister the Evangelical Lutheran Church of America]."

5280 Magazine

In "Love Wins Over Hate," Colorado filmmaker (and mother to Gov. Jared Polis) Susan Polis Schutz seeks to understand the roots of prejudice.

5280.com

Susan Polis Schutz’s New Documentary Gives a Face to Extremism

In "Love Wins Over Hate," Colorado filmmaker (and mother to Gov. Jared Polis) Susan Polis Schutz seeks to understand the roots of prejudice.In "Love Wins Over Hate," Colorado filmmaker (and mother to Gov. Jared Polis) Susan Polis Schutz seeks to understand the roots of prejudice.

entry.title: "After cutting service by 40 percent way back in April...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"After cutting service by 40 percent way back in April because of the coronavirus pandemic, the Regional Transportation District has now proposed rebalancing its remaining services to favor lines where people are still riding in significant numbers.

The agency wants your feedback as it formalizes that service plan, which will take effect in January 2021. "

Colorado Public Radio

The Regional Transportation District is facing a $215 million shortfall for its 2021 budget, and it's not clear just how long these service changes will stay in place.

cpr.org

This Week, You Can Tell RTD What You Think Of Its Pandemic 2.0 Service Plan

The Regional Transportation District is facing a $215 million shortfall for its 2021 budget, and it's not clear just how long these service changes will stay in place.The Regional Transportation District is facing a $215 million shortfall for its 2021 budget, and it's not clear just how long these service changes will stay in place.

An open discussion on why Denver needs Proposition 2A to pass. Our climate can't wait. Thanks to our panelists Lori Pace - Denver's Realtor, Jazmine Pace, and Harmony Cummings for making this a success.

entry.title: “We are finally cleaning up some of the inequities of the past...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“We are finally cleaning up some of the inequities of the past by pardoning 2,732 convictions for Coloradans who simply had an ounce of marijuana or less," Polis said. "It’s ridiculous how being written up for smoking a joint in the 1970s has followed some Coloradans throughout their lives and gotten in the way of their success."

CBS 8 - San Diego News

The governor's office said individuals who are unsure whether a conviction on their record has been pardoned may fill out a form to request confirmation of a pardon.

cbs8.com

Gov. Polis pardons those convicted of possessing 1 ounce or less of marijuana

The governor's office said individuals who are unsure whether a conviction on their record has been pardoned may fill out a form to request confirmation of a pardon.The governor's office said individuals who are unsure whether a conviction on their record has been pardoned may fill out a form to request confirmation of a pardon.

entry.title: "Colorado’s mail-in voting system sharply reduces the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Colorado’s mail-in voting system sharply reduces the chances of mass voter intimidation schemes, Weiser said. And so far, there haven’t been any rumblings about organized efforts to do so.

But Weiser said he’ll be watching.

“It is a crime. It’s a crime to take seriously,” Weiser told The Denver Post."

...

The Denver Post

entry.title: “When McAuliffe shared its hybrid learning plan with parents...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“When McAuliffe shared its hybrid learning plan with parents on back-to-school night September 17, the limits of learning during Covid became clear to many who had fantasized about a return to the traditional school day. Students will return to school, but mandates from Denver Health and the district restrict how learning can take place. At McAuliffe, cohorts of 35 will engage in face-to-face learning with a teacher for only one class each day. The rest of the day, students will learn remotely, in the company of their cohort and an educator to keep them on track.”

Front Porch Newspaper

When McAuliffe shared its hybrid learning plan with parents on back-to-school night September 17, the limits of learning during Covid became clear to many who had fantasized about a return to the traditional school day.

frontporchne.com

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

Styling: LILFRESHSAM
